com.coveros.selenified.application

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.application.App

  • public class App
extends Object
    App is an instance of the browser based application that is under test. Pages should be build out of this object (if using the page object model (POM)), so that several pages make up an app. Within each page, multiple elements should be created. In this way, we can act on our app, page, or element directly. If you choose not to use the POM, then simply build your elements directly out of your app.
    Version:
    3.3.0
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

      Sets up the app object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • App

        public App(Capabilities capabilities,
           Reporter reporter)
    throws InvalidBrowserException,
           MalformedURLException,
           InvalidProxyException
        Sets up the app object. Browser, and Output are defined here, which will control actions and all logging and records
        Parameters:
        capabilities - - what browser capabilities are desired
        reporter - - the TestOutput file. This is provided by the SeleniumTestBase functionality
        Throws:
        InvalidBrowserException - If a browser that is not one specified in the Selenium.Browser class is used, this exception will be thrown
        MalformedURLException - If the provided hub address isn't a URL, this exception will be thrown
        InvalidProxyException

    • Method Detail

      • newElement

        public Element newElement(Locator type,
                          String locator)
        setups a new element which is located on the page
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        Returns:
        Element: a page element to interact with

      • newElement

        public Element newElement(Locator type,
                          String locator,
                          int match)
        setups a new element which is located on the page
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        match - - if there are multiple matches of the selector, this is which match (starting at 0) to interact with
        Returns:
        Element: a page element to interact with

      • newElement

        public Element newElement(Locator type,
                          String locator,
                          Element parent)
        setups a new element which is located on the page
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        parent - - the parent of the element to be defined
        Returns:
        Element: a page element to interact with

      • newElement

        public Element newElement(Locator type,
                          String locator,
                          int match,
                          Element parent)
        setups a new element which is located on the page
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        match - - if there are multiple matches of the selector, this is which match (starting at 0) to interact with
        parent - - the parent of the element to be defined
        Returns:
        Element: a page element to interact with

      • get

        public Get get()
        Retrieves information about the app in general, not specific to any particular page or element. If an object isn't present, null will be returned

      • is

        public Is is()
        Checks information about the app in general, not specific to any particular page or element. A boolean is always returning, indicating if an object is present or not

      • waitFor

        public WaitFor waitFor()
        Performs dynamic waits on the app in general, until a particular condition of the application is met, not one for a particular page or element. Nothing is ever returned. The default wait is 5 seconds, but can be overridden. If the condition is not met in the allotted time, still nothing is returned, but an error is logged

      • azzert

        public Assert azzert()
        Will handle all assertions performed on the actual application itself. These asserts are custom to the framework, and in addition to providing easy object oriented desiredCapabilities, they take screenshots with each verification to provide additional traceability, and assist in troubleshooting and debugging failing tests. A failed assert will cause the test to immediately stop on the error.

      • verify

        public Verify verify()
        Will handle all verifications performed on the actual application itself. These verifications are custom to the framework, and in addition to providing easy object oriented desiredCapabilities, they take screenshots with each verification to provide additional traceability, and assist in troubleshooting and debugging failing tests. A failed verify will log the error, but continue on anyways, failing at the end due to the issues

      • getDriver

        public org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getDriver()
        Retrieves the Selenium driver instance
        Returns:
        WebDriver: access to the driver controlling the browser via webdriver

      • getBrowser

        public Browser getBrowser()
        Retrieves the browser being used for this particular test
        Returns:
        Browser: the enum of the browser

      • getReporter

        public Reporter getReporter()
        Retrieves the output file responsible for logging all actions and assertions associated with this particular test
        Returns:
        Reporter: the file recording all actions

      • getDesiredCapabilities

        public org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities getDesiredCapabilities()
        Retrieves the browser (and potentially device) desiredCapabilities setup for this particular test
        Returns:
        desiredCapabilities: the listing of set desiredCapabilities

      • killDriver

        public void killDriver()
        Ends the current Selenium driver instance, which will end the test. No additional actions or asserts can be performed after this, as the browser will be terminated as well

      • wait

        public void wait(double seconds)
        Pauses the test for a set amount of time
        Parameters:
        seconds - - the number of seconds to wait

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Go back one page in the current test's browser history

        public void goForward()
        Go forward one page in the current test's browser history

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Reloads the current page

      • refreshHard

        public void refreshHard()
        Reloads the current page while clearing the cache. This only works for certain browsers, as the command/control and F5 key combination is used to perform the action. Note that each time a test is run, nothing is currently in the cache, as each test is run in a completely new/fresh/clean session

      • setCookie

        public void setCookie(org.openqa.selenium.Cookie cookie)
        Adds a cookie to the application for this particular test
        Parameters:
        cookie - - the details of the cookie to set

      • deleteCookie

        public void deleteCookie(String cookieName)
        Deletes a stored cookie, indicated by the cookieName for this particular test. If the cookie by the provided name isn't present, than an error will be logged and recorded
        Parameters:
        cookieName - - the name of the cookie to delete

      • deleteAllCookies

        public void deleteAllCookies()
        Delete all stored cookies for this particular test

      • maximize

        public void maximize()
        Maximizes the current window

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Resize the current window to the specified size
        Parameters:
        width - - the desired width of the browser
        height - - the desired height of the browser

      • scroll

        public void scroll(int desiredPosition)
        An custom script to scroll to a given position on the page, using javascript. If the browser being used doesn't support javascript, or the page isn't long enough to support scrolling to the desired position, than an error will be logged and recorded
        Parameters:
        desiredPosition - - the position on the page to scroll to

      • openNewWindow

        public void openNewWindow(String url)
        Opens a new tab, and have it selected. The page provided will be loaded
        Parameters:
        url - - the url to load once the new tab is opened and selected

      • switchToNewWindow

        public void switchToNewWindow()
        Switches to the next window. This is an alternative to switchNextTab or switchPreviousTab, as this works better for some systems and environments that others.

      • switchToParentWindow

        public void switchToParentWindow()
        Switches to the originally opened window. This is an alternative to switchNextTab or switchPreviousTab, as this works better for some systems and environments that others.

      • closeCurrentWindow

        public void closeCurrentWindow()
        Close the currently selected window. After this window is closed, ensure that focus is shifted to the next window using switchToNewWindow or switchToParentWindow methods. This is an alternative to closeTab, as this works better for some systems and environments that others.

      • selectMainWindow

        public void selectMainWindow()
        Select the main window. Used for returning to the main content after selecting a frame. If there are nested frames, the main content will be selected, not the next frame in the parent child relationship

      • selectParentFrame

        public void selectParentFrame()
        Select the parent frame. Used for returning to the next frame up after selecting a frame. If there are nested frames, the main content won't be selected, however the next frame in the parent child relationship will be

      • selectFrame

        public void selectFrame(int frameNumber)
        Select a frame by its (zero-based) index. That is, if a page has three frames, the first frame would be at index 0, the second at index 1 and the third at index 2. Once the frame has been selected, all subsequent calls on the WebDriver interface are made to that frame.
        Parameters:
        frameNumber - - the frame number, starts at 0

      • selectFrame

        public void selectFrame(String frameIdentifier)
        Select a frame by its name or ID. Frames located by matching name attributes are always given precedence over those matched by ID.
        Parameters:
        frameIdentifier - - the frame name or ID

      • acceptCertificate

        public void acceptCertificate()
        Safari, Edge and IE don't recognize the allowInsecureCert capability. As a result, an alternative method is provided in order to 'manually' accept the problematic certificate

      • acceptAlert

        public void acceptAlert()
        Accept (click 'OK' on) an alert box

      • acceptConfirmation

        public void acceptConfirmation()
        Accept (click 'OK' on) a confirmation box

      • dismissConfirmation

        public void dismissConfirmation()
        Dismiss (click 'Cancel' on) a confirmation box

      • acceptPrompt

        public void acceptPrompt()
        Accept (click 'OK' on) a prompt box

      • dismissPrompt

        public void dismissPrompt()
        Dismiss (click 'Cancel' on) a prompt box

      • typeIntoPrompt

        public void typeIntoPrompt(String text)
        Type text into a prompt box
        Parameters:
        text - - the text to type into the prompt
